DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of different doses of cyclosporine given concomitantly with a fixed dose of sirolimus in kidney transplant recipients.
DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Cyclosporine Reduction in Kidney Transplant Recipients Receiving Sirolimus
DOC.detailed_description: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of different doses of cyclosporine given concomitantly with a fixed dose of sirolimus in kidney transplant recipients. Cyclosporine blood levels, graft rejection rates and renal function will be assessed.
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria At least 18 years of age Endstage renal disease in patients receiving a primary or secondary renal allograft from a cadaveric, livingunrelated, or livingrelated mismatched donor Patients with secondary kidney transplant must have maintained primary graft for at least 6 months Exclusion criteria Antibody induction within one week of current transplantation Multiorgan transplants Patients at highrisk of rejection
